sentences.sentence: Russia's defence ministry again hailed the success of its newest hypersonic missiles in Ukraine, which it claims destroyed a fuel storage site used by Ukraine's military in the south of the country.

sentences.sentence: For now, there are no reports of casualties here, but this is, of course, a signal that the fighting continues to intensify in the outskirts of Kyiv.

But we have seen at least one funeral ceremony for a soldier earlier today. We were not allowed to film there, but we've heard reports of multiple funerals being held here in Kyiv over the last few days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For now, the official death toll on the Ukrainian side remains at 1,300 soldiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: That is according to the Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, who announced this figure last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, according to the Ukrainian army, over 14,000 Russian troops have been killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: At a liturgy earlier today, we spoke to a few soldiers who told us they have faith they will win this war. They say they have already surprised the entire world with the amount of time they have been able to resist. Many international analysts gave them only a few days, and here they are almost a month into this conflict and are still able to hold their capital. Anneliese Borges from Kyiv for Euronews. Volunteers in Lviv are teaching civilians how to defend themselves as Russia's assault on Ukraine continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The city is the last outpost before Poland, however Friday's strike just outside the international airport has served as a reminder that no city in Ukraine is off limits.

sentences.sentence: Instructor Denis Yurenko estimates that his group have already coached more than a thousand people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So our program is designed for the people who have zero experience and even for the people who never held a gun in their hands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So first we tell the huge story about safety, because that's the fundamental.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They need not to kill their people and not to kill themselves and not to injure themselves, which is why we spend a lot of time describing and showing different cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Then we show the basic manipulations of how to unload the gun, how to load the gun, how to reload the gun, how to stand, how to hold, how to aim.

sentences.sentence: Basic first aid is also taught and includes demonstrations of how to use a tourniquet to stop the flow of blood through a vein or artery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Algeria has recalled its ambassador to Spain after Madrid changed a 42-year-old policy

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: towards its former colony, Western Sahara. Madrid used to be neutral over whether it should gain independence, but now it's sided with Morocco's proposal to give Western Sahara. Madrid used to be neutral over whether it should gain independence, but now it's sided with Morocco's proposal to give Western Sahara limited autonomy. Algeria, meanwhile, wants it to be independent. And although Spain receives about 40 percent of its gas from Algeria, its foreign minister hinted last week that working with Morocco to tackle migration was a more important issue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And we face this new period with the determination to jointly address common challenges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
